page.title: 13BIGGLESWADE:ADULT EDUCATION1
page.content: Arrangements for adult education, mainly in the form of evening classes, exist at the Stratton Community College. The Upper School campus and facilities are used for this amenity. Classes are co-ordinated by an adult education tutor with the help of an administrative assistant, and run on three evenings per week for periods of 5,10 or 20 weeks for non-vocational subjects or 30 weeks in the case of courses which lead to external exam- inations. Enrolment takes place during September and current fees payable to Beds. County Council are based on an hourly rate of 76p for non-vocational courses and 33p for vocational ones. Young persons, over 16 and under 18 yrs., out of full-time education, pay a reduced sum. The centre serves the population of Biggleswade and the surrounding villages.
